statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Moten scores 16 and Mercer beats Furman 67-64
article.headline: Moten scores 16 and Mercer beats Furman 67-64
article.linkText: Moten scores 16 and Mercer beats Furman 67-64
article.story: MACON, Ga. -- Darious Moten scored 16 points, T.J. Hallice added 13 and Ike Nwamu 12 as Mercer beat Furman 67-64 on Thursday night. Hallice gave Mercer (10-9, 5-1 Southern Conference) the lead for good at 59-57 on a layup with 3:53 left. Stephen Croone's free throws with 23 seconds left pulled Furman (4-12, 2-4) to 63-62, but the Bears made 4 of 6 free throws from there to secure the win. The Bears led by 14 in the first half and went into the break with a 36-29 edge. The Paladins closed the gap to 42-40 with a 9-2 run and later tied it at 57 but never pulled ahead in the second half. Devin Sibley was 4 of 4 from 3-point range to lead Furman with 21 points and Croone added 15. Mercer was 24 of 41 (58.5 percent) from the field and outrebounded Furman 29-15.
